intro: Beaupreopsis paniculata, commonly known as the panicled beaupreopsis, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are ovate to elliptic in shape, with a smooth surface and serrated edges. Beaupreopsis paniculata is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to saline environments.
